content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 5.25 - Executive order no. 25: establishing a task force on state work force management and employee deployment

State Regulations
WHEREAS, the planned reduction of the State work force does
not eliminate the need to fill critical position vacancies in order for the

State to fulfill its mission; WHEREAS, a centrally coordinated method of identifying, assessing and managing position vacancies across all State agencies is
essential for prudent deployment of the State work force; WHEREAS, more flexible deployment of the State work force
would assist in avoiding or mitigating the involuntary separation of
employees; WHEREAS, privatization of certain State assets or
contracting out certain State functions or services may create the need to find
alternative employment opportunity for affected employees; WHEREAS, current State law, rules or regulations may impede
the flexibility necessary to manage the reduction and redeployment of the work
force; and
WHEREAS, effective management of State position vacancies
is required to provide mandated and necessary State services with the optimal
staffing levels needed for the delivery of those services; NOW, THEREFORE, I, GEORGE E. PATAKI, Governor of the State
of New York, by virtue of the authority vested in me by the Constitution and

Laws of the State of New York, do hereby order as follows: I. Task Force on State Work Force Management
and Employee Deployment

There is hereby created the Task Force on State Work Force

Management and Employee Deployment. The Task Force shall be chaired by the

Director of State Operations and shall include the Directors of the Office of

Employee Relations and Division of the Budget, the Commissioners of the

Departments of Civil Service and Labor and such other members as the Director
of State Operations shall deem appropriate. Members of the Task Force shall
receive no extra compensation beyond that provided in their current State
positions, but shall be entitled to reimbursement for any necessary expenses
incurred in connection with the performance of their Task Force duties. II. Powers and Responsibilities of
the Task Force

The Task Force shall make recommendations for coordinating
and facilitating State agencies' efforts to: identify vacancies and
opportunities for redeployment to those vacancies; maximize comparability
determinations to assist redeployment; identify retraining opportunities that
offer potential reemployment for affected employees; provide necessary job
placement, counseling, and job search services to employees; implement State
agency staff reduction efforts including the use of various separation
incentives that may be available; and within the context of the above, manage
the State work force to reflect the most prudent use of existing
employees. The Task Force shall identify any modifications to laws, rules or regulations as necessary to carry out its recommendations. III. Cooperation of State Agencies

The Director of State Operations shall be responsible for
assuring that State agencies, departments, divisions, boards or offices shall
cooperate with and provide such assistance as may be requested by the Task

Force. Signed: George E. PatakiDated: February 7, 1996
[FN*] [Revoked by Executive Order No. 5 (Eliot Spitzer), infra.]
[Revoked by Executive Order No. 9 (David A. Paterson), infra.]
